ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: For when the Trumpet is blown,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: When the Trumpet shall be sounded,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: So when the Trumpet will be blown.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Then, when the Naqur is sounded.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: For when the trumpet is sounded,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: For when the Trump is sounded
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: For when the trumpet shall sound,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Then when the horn shall be blown,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: When the Trumpet will be sounded,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Finally, when the Trumpet is sounded,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Then, when the Trumpet is sounded (i.e. its second blowing);
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And when the trumpet is blown,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [74:8] For when the trumpet is sounded, when the trumpet is blown, that is, the Horn (qarn), at the second blast,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (For when the trumpet shall sound) which is the sound of the Trumpet announcing the Resurrection,
